data.scheme_name: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy 2023-28 - Powerloom Sector (Private Powerloom) - Capital Subsidy - Female - All Categories - Existing
data.benefits: The scheme offers financial assistance to private powerloom units by providing a capital subsidy ranging from 35% to 50% on fixed capital investment, depending on the specific zone.
data.eligibility: All existing units engaged in Private Powerloomssector are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. 
The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project.
The detailed project report (DPR) of the new textile unit will include the cost of setting up the solar power plant up to a maximum limit of 4 MW.
If a unit has more than 50 women employees, it must provide a childcare facility to qmore than 50% of the employees.
More than 50% of the employees working must be women in the units being run by women.
In the case of electricity subsidy for existing units, subsidy will be provided or a period of 2 years only.
Post the set period of 2 years, no electricity subsidy will be provided. However, the subsidy amount of 12 months will be calculated and provided as capital subsidy for establishment of solar power plant.
The units will be considered for technology upgradation under the MAHA Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (MAHA-TUFS), provided:  
The unit has completed 15 years of production on the existing machinery. 
The unit has a net positive worth. 
The unit uses clean energy.

data.context: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy of the State is in line with the 5F vision of the Government of India- Farm to Fiber to Factory to Fashion to Foreign. The policy envisions integrating the whole textile value chain and create an enabling environment for sustained growth of all sub-sectors in the industry.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the sector and encourage units in various parts of the State.
data.description:
Financial Assistance in form of Capital Subsidy-% (on fixed capital investment):
Zone 1 - 50% on fixed capital investment
Zone 2 - 45% on fixed capital investment
Zone 3 - 40% on fixed capital investment
Zone 4 - 35% on fixed capital investment

Electricity subsidy for 12 months (i.e. there will be a cap of Rs. 40 lakh per unit per month on the disbursement of monthly electricity subsidy/ cost of the power plant up to maximum of 4MW/ capping of Rs.480 lakhs, whichever is less)

Maharashtra Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (MAHA-TUFS):
Capital Investment Subsidy (CIS) -
Zone 1 - 40% of the basic cost of eligible machinery or Rs 2500 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 2 - 35% of the basic cost of eligible machinery or Rs 2000 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 3 - 30% of the basic cost of eligible machinery or Rs 1500 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 4 - 25% of the basic cost of eligible machinery or Rs 1000 lakhs, whichever is less
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the Maharashtra Textile Department : https://etextile.maharashtra.gov.in/registration
data.funding_mechanism:
The capital subsidy will be provided in 2 equal instalments (with a gap of six months between the instalments) post the operationalization of solar power plant.
This will be paid in two installments:
1st instalment: 60% of eligible amount after 12 months.  
2nd instalment: 40% of eligible amount after 24 months.
data.additional_info:
Zone 1: - Amravati, Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Nagpur, Washim, Wardha, Yavatmal.
Zone 2: - Aurangabad, Beed, Dhule, Hingoli, Jalgaon, Jalna, Latur, Nanded, Osmanabad, Parbhani.
Zone 3: - Ahmednagar, Nashik, Nandurbar.
Zone 4: - Kolhapur, Mumbai City, Mumbai Suburban, Palaghar, Pune, Ratnagiri, Raigad, Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara, Solapur, Thane.
Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. Such expansion will include forward and backward integration.
